text: Are Python list comprehensions the same thing as map/grep in Perl?
I was having some trouble grokking the list comprehension syntax in Python, so I started thinking about how to achieve the same thing in Perl, which I'm more familiar with.
I realized that the basic examples (taken from this page) can all be done in Perl with map or grep.

code:
(python)                            (perl)                  
S = [x**2 for x in range(10)]       @S = map { $_**2 } ( 0..9 );
V = [2**i for i in range(13)]       @V = map { 2**$_ } ( 0..12 );
M = [x for x in S if x % 2 == 0]    @M = grep { $_ % 2 == 0 } @S;

text: So is "list comprehension" just a fancy term for "map and/or filter a list" or is there more to it?
